story:
Once upon a time, in the bustling city of Baghdad, there lived a young girl named Layla. Layla was a kind and curious girl with a heart as big as the Tigris River that flowed through the city. She loved exploring the vibrant markets, listening to the enchanting tales of the storytellers in the square, and gazing up at the twinkling stars that illuminated the night sky.

One evening, as Layla's father tucked her into bed, she asked him for a story. With a gentle smile, her father began to tell her a tale of a magical garden hidden deep within the city. This garden was said to be filled with the most beautiful flowers that bloomed in every color of the rainbow, and trees that whispered ancient secrets to those who listened closely.

Intrigued by the story, Layla begged her father to take her to see the garden. So, the next morning, they set out on a journey through the cobblestone streets and bustling alleyways of Baghdad. They followed the clues from the story until they reached a quiet corner of the city where a hidden gate stood covered in ivy.

As they pushed open the gate, Layla gasped in wonder as the secret garden unfolded before her. The air was filled with the scent of jasmine and roses, and colorful butterflies danced among the flowers. Birds chirped melodiously in the branches above, and a gentle breeze rustled the leaves like a soothing lullaby.

Layla and her father spent the day exploring the magical garden, marveling at its beauty and feeling a deep sense of peace and tranquility. As the sun began to set, they sat together on a cozy bench, watching the sky change colors from blue to pink to purple.

As they made their way back home, Layla felt grateful for the special adventure she had shared with her father. Snuggled in her bed that night, she drifted off to sleep with dreams of the magical garden and all the wonders that awaited her in the world outside her window.

And so, in the city of Baghdad, where stories and dreams intertwine, Layla and her father found joy and enchantment in the simple moments of life, making memories that would forever light up the darkest of nights.

Sweet dreams, my dear Layla. The world is full of magic if you only believe.
